decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards and mana acceleration to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. It aims to control the game through counterspells and removal, while also utilizing cards like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to draw into more resources. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds a recursion element to the deck, allowing for additional value from its graveyard. Overall, this Dimir Control deck is designed to outlast opponents and grind out victories through efficient resource management and powerful plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures and control spells to slow down the opponent's game plan, while also having access to powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. With a mix of efficient removal spells, counter magic, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and overpower them with threats like Tarmogoyf, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Hullbreacher. By disrupting the opponent's resources and developing a strong board presence, this deck looks to control the game and secure a victory through attrition and tempo advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly generating card advantage using Bazaar of Baghdad to fill the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine and Hollow One. By utilizing cards like Noxious Revival and Force of Vigor, it can disrupt opponents' strategies while maintaining pressure with aggressive creatures like Basking Rootwalla and Blazing Rootwalla. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats and disruption, using the graveyard as a resource to consistently apply pressure and control the game. It leverages powerful cards like Force of Will and Wasteland to protect its game plan and disrupt opponents' strategies.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies while maintaining a strong board presence through efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes cards like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to slow down the opponent, while also generating value with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck aims to control the game through counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also having access to powerful card draw and tutor effects like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells and utilizing wasteland effects for additional disruption.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting opponent's strategies, drawing cards, and efficiently using resources. It utilizes powerful control cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Counterspells to control the board. It also includes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage. The deck has a solid mana base with powerful mana accelerants like Black Lotus and Moxen, allowing it to cast its spells efficiently. It also has cards like Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den for alternative win conditions.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage through the use of powerful spells like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Demonic Tutor. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration from artifacts like Black Lotus and the Moxes, as well as land disruption with Wasteland and Strip Mine. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to control the game by countering threats, drawing cards, and removing opposing threats with removal spells like Fatal Push. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and win through superior card advantage and control.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The key strategy revolves around efficiently using resources like mana acceleration from Moxen, card draw from Mishra's Bauble, and tutoring with Demonic Tutor to set up powerful plays. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a Companion allows for additional value by recasting cheap permanents from the graveyard. Overall, the deck excels at adapting to different matchups and managing resources effectively.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo quickly and efficiently, using cards like Dark Ritual and Black Lotus to generate mana, while also including a suite of powerful draw spells and tutors to find key combo pieces. The goal is to use Doomsday to set up a winning stack of cards, often including Thassa's Oracle as a win condition. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Squee, Goblin Nabob and Hollow One, then use cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Noxious Revival to bring back Vengevine and other key creatures. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will, Force of Negation, and other counter spells to protect its aggressive gameplan. With a focus on graveyard recursion and powerful creatures, this Bazaar Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early aggression and repeated threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful midrange creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It combines fast mana acceleration with disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe to slow down the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to generate advantage and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage and consistently apply pressure. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro - Bazaar Aggro deck is to utilize cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures such as Hollow One and Vengevine. By doing so, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will and Force of Vigor. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Poxwalkers and Strip Mine to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. It also leverages the powerful card advantage provided by cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck's win condition is to control the board and out-value the opponent through efficient use of mana, card advantage, and disruption. It aims to win the game through attrition rather than through aggressive strategies. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional consistency to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base while deploying aggressive creatures that also disrupt their game plan. By utilizing hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's plays and control the tempo of the game. Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria further hinder the opponent's ability to develop their board. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration cards like Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb to ensure an early advantage. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive elements.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifacts and lands to disrupt the opponent while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck includes cards like Sphere of Resistance, Null Rod, and Nettlecyst to slow down the opponent's plays, while deploying threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Patchwork Automaton to quickly end the game. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland provide additional utility by disrupting the opponent's mana base. Overall, this deck aims to control the game through resource denial and overwhelming aggression.

The deck focuses on aggressive Azorius creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while also utilizing key artifacts like Moxen and powerful spells to control the game. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells and removal, while also having the ability to combo off with cards like Tinker and Time Vault. The inclusion of Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and other disruptive creatures further adds to the deck's ability to control the game and secure a quick victory. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistency and allow for powerful plays early in the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures with hatebear abilities to disrupt opponent's strategies while controlling the board with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex. It also includes powerful ramp and mana acceleration cards like Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats. The deck utilizes resource denial with Wasteland and strip mine, as well as disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting opponent's game plan to secure a victory.
